trans-unit.source: Step 7: Test the Azure BizTalk Solution
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Test the Azure BizTalk Solution

trans-unit.source: Test the <token>af_integration</token> EAI scenario by sending a XML sales order message to the endpoint where the <token>request_response</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Test the <token>af_integration</token> EAI scenario by sending a XML sales order message to the endpoint where the <token>request_response</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: To send a message to the bridge
trans-unit.target: To send a message to the bridge

trans-unit.source: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Build the project and use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command line executable to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Build the project and use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command line executable to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: This tool accepts command line parameters; the sequence and usage of those parameters are:
trans-unit.target: This tool accepts command line parameters; the sequence and usage of those parameters are:

trans-unit.source: Where:
trans-unit.target: Where:

trans-unit.source: Parameter name
trans-unit.target: Parameter name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ACSNamespace
trans-unit.target: ACSNamespace

trans-unit.source: The Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: The Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Issuer Key for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Key for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: RuntimeAddress
trans-unit.target: RuntimeAddress

trans-unit.source: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: You got this address in <link xlink:href="ed997cf1-37f1-4810-b0ce-6ad174ee7bf7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6: Build and Deploy the Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: You got this address in <link xlink:href="ed997cf1-37f1-4810-b0ce-6ad174ee7bf7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6: Build and Deploy the Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: MessageFilePath
trans-unit.target: MessageFilePath

trans-unit.source: Path to the file that contains the request message to be sent to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Path to the file that contains the request message to be sent to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: This request message must be compliant with the <embeddedLabel>ECommerceSalesOrder.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema.
trans-unit.target: This request message must be compliant with the <embeddedLabel>ECommerceSalesOrder.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema.

trans-unit.source: You can create an XML instance request message using the request schema you created in <link xlink:href="3ff6545f-a395-48d9-80d9-c756f987bf98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Create SalesOrder Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can create an XML instance request message using the request schema you created in <link xlink:href="3ff6545f-a395-48d9-80d9-c756f987bf98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Create SalesOrder Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the SalesOrder.xml sample message available in the sample at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the SalesOrder.xml sample message available in the sample at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: ContentType
trans-unit.target: ContentType

trans-unit.source: Determine whether it’s an XML message or an EDI message:
trans-unit.target: Determine whether it’s an XML message or an EDI message:

trans-unit.source: For XML message, set this to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For XML message, set this to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For EDI message, set this to <embeddedLabel>text/plain</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For EDI message, set this to <embeddedLabel>text/plain</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, to test the EAI scenario, open a command prompt, go to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project, and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, to test the EAI scenario, open a command prompt, go to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project, and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: This application sends the message to the deployed endpoint and prints the success/failure message.
trans-unit.target: This application sends the message to the deployed endpoint and prints the success/failure message.

trans-unit.source: Upon successful completion, the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table in Northwind’s database has a new sales order entry created.
trans-unit.target: Upon successful completion, the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table in Northwind’s database has a new sales order entry created.
